text: Sorry, I figured it out already, but I have a question
Is there any authentication I could use?
I was using the API in Javascript as it is in your docs, but in that way the endpoint URL is exposed

Can I add an authentication to my endpoint so I can prevent spam getting through? Added a post here for more context: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Changing-forms-API-endpoint/m-p/376456>
You cannot use API endpoints in client-side Javascript if they require secrets.
That's why I changed the API to be used from PHP instead
Is there a reason you’re not using the embeddable forms?

Yes, several:
• I want to have full control of the HTML and the forms in general
• If HubSpot goes down or there's an error with the service we would lose all the leads that couldn't use the forms (already happened last year)
• Using the API allows me to send all the data as a backup to a spreadsheet
• Easier to apply styling
Also after the form is submitted I can add custom HTML as a response and not just some text
In that case - you’re going to need to handle the anti-spam logic yourself - so using something such as recaptcha
No so, I am already managing the spam with a honeypot and has been working fine. The problem is that as I was using Javascript's API, you could see the endpoint in the network tab in Google Chrome
Now I can use cURL from a terminal and send data directly into HubSpot
without even being in the website
As the endpoint can't change, someone already have that endpoint and is sending a form submission every 2-3 seconds since Thursday
That's why I'm asking if you provide any authentication key or something that I could use in PHP and would prevent somebody else using the endpoint URL without that key
Yeah, sorry I’m not sure - only thing I can think of is creating a new form.
The problem is that we have several forms on the website, and the form ID is in the HTML :disappointed:

Hi <@UKCGLNZL4>, I am in the same situation and I wanted to know if it is *now possible* to send an email via a custom object?

Thanks for your help ! :hugging_face:
I see that there's an option in HubSpot to generate API Keys, can't this key be used along with HubSpot's API endpoint URL?
Im not best placed to answer this unfortunately - but as the HS forms are submitted via AJAX/from the client, they naturally need a CORS-free/publicly accessible endpoint
I understand that, that's why I've removed that from the javascript so it's not publicly accessible anymore, but it shocks me that there's no way from PHP to use an authentication key

Morning guys, is it possible to add blog tags to the search listing results page? If so do I have to do this via API? Just so theres no confusion, to the actual listing item itself. I can see we have title and description along with featured image but nothing for the tags.
So for most endpoints authentication is required

the forms create endpoint is one which doesn’t require authentication - and that is because it’s required by client side applications (in particular HubSpot’s form javascript library) as far as I’m aware, there is no way to make that API “private”
Yeah I get it, but moving the API call to PHP allows using a private key
Just wondering if from HubSpot is there a way of somehow manage private keys along with the data being submitted
Is there a way to assign a Task creator using the Engagements API?  All my tasks are showing up as "No Owner" even though I've made a createdBy variable in my script.

<@U01BM4NDMPH> you should send
```{
    "engagement": {
        "ownerId": 10936145
    }
}```
You can't set Task Creator (createdBy), just Task Owner (ownerId)
That's creating the owner of the task, not the creator of the task.  It shows on the UI as "assigned to" correctly, but not the Task Created By.
Ok, but I guess then my question is... why not?  I can make a createdBy for Meetings and other types of engagements.
you can't make a createdBy for Meetings, This field is a meeting's owner
Daniel, el Token se ha caducado me da la sensación.
About Products objects.  Does anyone know if there is any Key ID . Like in Contacts emails or in Companies Company Domain? thanks in advance :wink:
hey <@U01BUM6324D>!  out of an abundance of caution, I would recommend removing the oAuth token in your message and replace with XXX or something

I was sure I could with meetings, hmm.  I see now that it didn't work like I thought it had.  I pulled a report of activities by creator and the vast majority of them are "unassigned" because they were created via API.  Thanks for your help today <@U01BSNHRCQJ>!
<@U01BM4NDMPH> no problem)

hi. i have a Vue.js form that’s submitting directly to a HubSpot form via the Forms API (POST <https://api.hsforms.com/submissions/v3/integration/submit/:portalId/:formGuid>). everything worked perfectly through a big batch of QC on staging, but now that we’ve gone to production, our marketing manager is getting “_The cookie needed to link form submissions to existing contacts isn’t being sent. You’ll need to ask your developer to update the integration for this form._”

I’ve used this forms API before, and we’ve never seen this message, not even with the form and VueJS file I cloned and modified for this. Might Recaptcha3 be blocking something? I can’t find anything helpful online. What am I supposed to update?
Is the Vue.js form/app on a HS site?
That error indicates that the submission wont be linked up to the HS analytics on the site - To resolve it you’ll need to read the HubSpotutk cookie and pass it as a field to the POST request.
If you search for “hutk” on the page here: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>

“Please Note While the hutk value is not required for the submission to be accepted, this token is used to associate analytics data with a contact record, so without this you will not see any page views or analytics source data for the contact record.”
hmmmm. this is NOT a HubSpot site
nor is the staging site, obvi
so why would this be an issue in production but submitted with no warnings on staging? it was submitting to the same HS form
and why not on the other forms we’ve done this with? i’ve never pulled a cookie to pass over. our QC repeatedly uses the same address, as do i in unit testing.
ok i’m seeing that the context IS in there… something must be failing. i’ll keep looking, thanks Kieran.
It’s a notice - so you can ignore it if you’re not using HS analytics on the site I imagine.
<@UD53A9UUR> well I changed the tokens, that's why the first one isn't the same that the last one. But I will replace it. Thank you
If you have a link to the site would be happy to take a look
yeah they do want to look at the analytics. it looks like the tracking code got uninstalled. but why it wouldn’t fire the notice on staging or local is weird.
getting hold of the developer who built the base layouts, so he can add the code
Can you give a bit more context, or a screen shot, or something?

I have seen varying and weird behavior in this area throughout the various APIs not just engagement. Sometimes I was able to mark the creator as a headless user for my API automations, other times I was not able, and when creating via API the creator is forever blank and cannot be set by us users from outside of HubSpot's backend. It would be a good idea if we could raise this one as an idea, I think, because the behavior is weird, inconsistent, and not always accurate, if you are creating records on behalf of particular users (which I do all the time).

Hello. I am trying to use Python to get all of my Company contacts. However I keep getting a KeyError for the "has-more" function. From what I've read elsewhere, I think it actually has something to do with the "response_dict" being blank, but I'm not sure how to fix it.

```import requests
import json
import urllib

max_results = 10 
hapikey = 'myAPIkey' 
limit = 10 
company_list = []
get_all_companies_url = "<https://api.hubapi.com/companies/v2/companies/paged?hapikey=myAPIkey>"
parameter_dict = {'hapikey': hapikey, 'limit': limit}
headers = {}

# Paginate your request using offset
has_more = True
while has_more:
	parameters = urllib.urlencode(parameter_dict)
	get_url = get_all_companies_url + parameters
	r = requests.get(url= get_url, headers = headers)
	response_dict = json.loads(r.text)
	has_more = response_dict['has-more']
	company_list.extend(response_dict['companies'])
	parameter_dict['offset']= response_dict['offset']
	if len(company_list) >= max_results: # Exit pagination, based on whatever value you've set your max results variable to.
		print('maximum number of results exceeded')
		break
 
print('loop finished')

list_length = len(company_list) 

print("You've succesfully parsed through {} company records and added them to a list".format(list_length))```
The error I am getting is this:

```PS C:\Users\HubSpot> & "C:/Program Files/Python38/python.exe" "c:/Users/Dropbox/HubSpot/companies.py"    
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:/Users/Droppbox/HubSpot/companies.py", line 30, in <module>
    has_more = response_dict['has-more']
KeyError: 'has-more'```

hello! We have defined a custom token for "password reset" emails. This token is defined when the reset email is initiated by API, and is currently working when we use a HS CTA linked with the token {{custom.reset_password}}.

If we replace the HS CTA with an HTML CTA coded with the same token, will HS still recognize it the same way?

Testing in HS isn't possible, since the token is defined by the API when the email is triggered. I'm not a developer, so I can't test myself via the API; hoping someone might have an answer! Thank you!!
I have some working code to do this on a V3 company API, let me see about a sample.
I think for this, you need to replace `has_more = response_dict['has-more']` with `has_more = response_dict.get('has-more') or False`
here is kind of a sample of how I do it in my code

```def hs_deal_batch_get():
    deals = []

    <http://log.info|log.info>('deal report: starting ...')

    data = {
        'filterGroups': [
            {
                'filters': [
                    { 'propertyName': 'pipeline', 'operator': 'EQ', 'value': CONFIGURATION['pipeline']['deals'] },
                ]
            }
        ],
        'sorts': [
            { 'propertyName': 'dealId', 'direction': 'ASCENDING' },
        ],
        'properties': CONFIGURATION['deal_properties'],
        'limit': 100,
        'after': 0,
    }

    page = 1
    while True:
        response = <http://rest_client.post|rest_client.post>('<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/search>', data=json_dump(data))
        raw, status_code, level = hs_response_parse('deal report', response)

        for x in raw.results:
            deal = x.properties
            deal.id = x.id
            deals.append(deal)

        <http://log.info|log.info>('deal report: page %03d, deals: %03d', page, len(deals))
        after = raw.paging.next.after if raw.paging and raw.paging.next else None
        data['after'] = after
        page += 1

        if after is None:
            <http://log.info|log.info>('deal report: page %03d, deals: %03d, finished', page, len(deals))
            break

    return deals```
You could do something like a PHP CSRF / XSRF token to cut back on spammer activity, but, it is no guarantee. The closest guarantee is a RECAPTCHA, but you were pushing back on using that.
There is no way to do some kind of custom weird keying on HubSpot's side. When you take over the form processing you also take over the validation the requests are not bogus.
Yep... welcome to the fun...

Hello Folks,
I made a “Copy Deal” button on the Deal page.  It works nicely for deals with line items that have hs_product_id’s but how can my code look up the properties for custom products, i.e. those without an hs_product_id but with an hs_object_id?  If I use the /crm/v3/objects/products/products/{{hs_object_id}} I get a 404.
Thank you for your time.
<@UQYHX7CTD> no lo creo, lo hice minutos después de generar el token y lo hice 2 veces

Matthew, thanks for the response. I tried the first thing you posted and now I am getting the same error in a different location.

```PS C:\Users\HubSpot> & "C:/Program Files/Python38/python.exe" "c:/Users/Dropbox/HubSpot/companies.py"    
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:/Users/Droppbox/HubSpot/companies.py", line 31, in <module>
    company_list.extend(response_dict['companies'])
KeyError: 'companies'```
similar fix... `response_dict.get('companies') or []`
whoever made this code, put quite some bugs in it, when you are on the last page
Did you try <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search> with a search on the hs_object_id ?
Also did you try *`/crm/v3/objects/products/batch/read`*
<@U012W4YEUTX> <@U01BSNHRCQJ> <@UQERM7BLY> <@U01BBV0L2CF>
